TARGET: Monsanto Co. 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Monsanto Co.



LAST UPDATE: May 20, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 18, 2016



DEAL NO.: 863668


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

March 18, 2016

Attitude:

Neutral

Deal Description:

Bayer AG submitted a non-binding proposal to acquire Monsanto Co, which is reportedly valued for US$43 billion. The transaction is subject to due diligence, regulatory approvals and other conditions. The Board of Directors of Monsanto is reviewing the proposal. On May 12, 2016, it was reported that Bayer AG has held preliminary talks internally and with advisers to acquire Monsanto Co, which is valued for around US$43 billion. The two companies were already said to be discussing a possible combination back in March. Monsanto Co is located in St. Louis, Missouri, United States and engages in the distribution of agricultural.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$43,000,000,000

Price/Earnings:

29.944

Multiple of Book Value:

-41.992

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$43,000,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$52,028,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$43,000,000,000

Description:

TARGET: Syngenta AG /Mikado Brand Sulcotrione Herbicide Business/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Syngenta AG



LAST UPDATE: May 14, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 1, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 1, 2001



DEAL NO.: 138935


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 1, 2001

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer AG, Leverkusen, Nordrhein-Westfalen (North Rhine-Westphalia), Germany, the research based company with major businesses in health care, agriculture, polymers and specialty chemicals, acquired the Mikado Brand sulcotrione herbicide business of Syngenta AG for CHF172.6 million (US$106 million) in cash. Sulcotrione, marketed as Mikado brand, is a foliar-applied post-emergence herbicide from triketone class of compounds. The products major usage is in corn (maize). The Mikado purchase includes the European Economic Area (EEA) business and associated intellectual property rights, registrations and trademarks as well as production and formulation know-how. The business is to be sold in order to meet antitrust requirements. Syngenta AG was formed in November 2000 through the merger of Novartis Agribusiness and Zeneca Agrochemicals.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$105,871,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$105,870,639

Total Invested Capital:

$105,871,000

Base Equity Price:

$105,870,639


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Syngenta AG /Mikado Brand Sulcotrione Herbicide Business/

Country:

Switzerland

Exchange:

Other

Industry:

Healthcare; Chemicals, Paints & Coatings

Description:

Manufactures herbicides

TARGET: proPlant Gesellschaft Fuer Agrar- Und Umweltinformatik mbH 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: proPlant Gesellschaft Fuer Agrar- Und Umweltinformatik mbH



LAST UPDATE: February 19, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 15, 2016 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 15, 2016



DEAL NO.: 859062


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 15, 2016

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired proPlant Gesellschaft Fuer Agrar- Und Umweltinformatik mbH for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Bayer AG's portfolio of software solutions. Following the acquisition, proPlant Gesellschaft Fuer Agrar- Und Umweltinformatik mbH would be operating as Bayer Digital Farming GmbH. proPlant Gesellschaft Fuer Agrar- Und Umweltinformatik mbH is located in Münster, Nordrhein-Westfalen, Germany and designs and develops innovative software solutions in agricultural sector.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Steigerwald Arzneimittelwerk GmbH 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Steigerwald Arzneimittelwerk GmbH



LAST UPDATE: January 20, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 16, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 1, 2013



DEAL NO.: 755200


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2013

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Steigerwald Arzneimittelwerk GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would expand Bayer AG's product offerings and would provide it with growth opportunities. Following the transaction, all employees of Steigerwald Arzneimittelwerk GmbH would join Bayer AG. The transaction was subject to certain closing conditions including antitrust clearance. The acquisition was expected to close at the beginning of July 2013. Steigerwald Arzneimittelwerk GmbH is located in Darmstadt, Hessen, Germany and manufactures plant extract-based medicine. It had sales of approximately EUR61.3 million (US$78.8 million) in 2012 and 180 employees.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: CRISPR Therapeutics Ltd. 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: CRISPR Therapeutics Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: January 4, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 21, 2015



DEAL NO.: 852713


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer AG agreed to acquire a undisclosed minority stake in CRISPR Therapeutics Ltd for CHF34.8 million (US$35 million) in cash. The transaction is subject to customary conditions, including merger control clearance in the United States. CRISPR Therapeutics Ltd is a portfolio company of SR One Ltd, New Enterprise Associates LLC, Versant Venture Management LLC and Abingworth Management Ltd. CRISPR Therapeutics Ltd is located in Basel, Basel-Stadt (Basle Town), Switzerland and develops gene-based medicines. The deal is expected to occur in the first quarter of 2016.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Original Offer Price:

$35,074,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$35,074,070

Total Invested Capital:

$35,074,000

Base Equity Price:

$35,074,070

CRISPR Therapeutics Ltd.

Country:

Switzerland

Industry:

Health Services

Description:

Develops gene-based medicines

TARGET: SeedWorks International Pvt Ltd. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: SeedWorks International Pvt Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: June 3, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 1, 2015



DEAL NO.: 828899


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG agreed to acquire SeedWorks International Pvt Ltd, also known as SeedWorks India Pvt Ltd, a portfolio company of Wand Partners Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will strengthen Bayer CropScience AG's vegetable seed business in India. Founded in 1998, SeedWorks International Pvt Ltd is located in Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India and provides agricultural and farming services. It has around 180 employees and generated revenues of approximately INR1 billion (US$16.2 million) for the fiscal year 2013-2014. The deal is expected to close in the beginning of July 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

SeedWorks International Pvt Ltd.

India

Agricultural Production

Description:

Provides agricultural and farming services

TARGET: Thermoplast Composite GmbH 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: Thermoplast Composite GmbH



LAST UPDATE: March 25, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 2, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 2, 2015



DEAL NO.: 819181


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 2, 2015

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Thermoplast Composite GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would strengthen Bayer MaterialScience AG's position in key customer sectors and also allow entering into composites manufacturing industry. As part of the transaction, 12 employees of Thermoplast Composite GmbH would be retained by Bayer MaterialScience AG. Founded in 2007, Thermoplast Composite GmbH is located in Langenfeld, Nordrhein-Westfalen, Germany and produces thermoplastic fiber composites.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Thermoplast Composite GmbH

Country:

Germany

Description:

Produces thermoplastic fiber composites

TARGET: Cooperativa Central Gaúcha Ltda. /Seed Bus/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: Cooperativa Central Gaúcha Ltda



LAST UPDATE: March 20, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 19, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 19, 2015



DEAL NO.: 814885


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 19, 2015

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG acquired the business and assets of the seed business of Cooperativa Central Gaúcha Ltda, for an undisclosed amount. Located in Cruz Alta, Brazil, the acquired business researches and develops agricultural seeds. The acquisition is subject to the regulatory approval from the Brazilian antitrust authority CADE (Conselho Administrativo de Defesa Econômica). As of March 19, 2015, CADE had already approved the deal.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Cooperativa Central Gaúcha Ltda. /Seed Bus/

Brazil

Industry:

Description:

Researches and develops agricultural seeds

ANNOUNCE DATE: February 27, 2014

DEAL NO.: 780703


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 3, 2014

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Kunming Dihon Pharmaceutical Co Ltd, formerly known as Dihon Pharmaceutical Group Co Ltd, for RMB3.6 billion (US$587.8 million). The acquisition was subject to antitrust approval. Kunming Dihon Pharmaceutical Co Ltd is located in Yunnan, China and manufactures pharmaceutical products. With approximately 2,400 employees, the company generated RMB1 billion (US$168.1 million) in 2013 revenues. The transaction was expected to be completed in second half of 2014. On July 4, 2014, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce's anti-monopoly bureau has approved the transaction.

TARGET: E.I. Du Pont De Nemours & Co. /Crop Protection Land Mgmt Ops/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Co.



LAST UPDATE: December 10, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 29, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 1, 2014



DEAL NO.: 809738


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 1, 2014

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG acquired the business and assets of the Crop Protection Land Management business of EI Du Pont De Nemours & Co for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition includes the Crop Protection Land Management assets of EI Du Pont De Nemours & Co in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Australia and New Zealand. The acquisition would expand Bayer CropScience AG's pest and weed control business. Following the transaction, Barclift, product manager, would join Industrial Vegetation Management business and would lead the conceptualization, planning and implementation of marketing strategies and tactics for the Industrial Vegetation Management business and 16 employees from EI Du Pont De Nemours & Co would join the Bayer Industrial Vegetation Management team in the United States. The transaction was subject to receipt of required antitrust approvals and was originally expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2014. The acquired business provides weed control solutions. The business has reported sales of US$63.7 million during the year 2013.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Exchange:

Industry:

Description:

Provides weed control solutions

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Merck & Co., Inc. /Consumer Healthcare Business/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Merck & Co., Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 7, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 6, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 1, 2014



DEAL NO.: 779339


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 1, 2014

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired the assets and operations of Merck & Co Inc's consumer healthcare business for US$14.2 billion. Under the terms of the transaction, the agreement included an upfront payment of US$1 billion. The acquisition is in line with Merck & Co Inc's strategy of keeping with its core businesses to maximize shareholder value. The acquisition also enhances the over-the-counter business of Bayer AG. The transaction was initially a rumor with a number of bidders interested to acquire the assets and operations of Merck & Co Inc's consumer healthcare business for a value up to US$14 billion. Merck & Co Inc hired Morgan Stanley to assist in the sales process. Sources reported that potential bidders included Novartis AG, Bayer AG, Reckitt Benckiser Group and Procter & Gamble Co. The target business is located in the United States and manufactures consumer healthcare products. On February 12, 2014, Merck & Co Inc reported that it received preliminary offers, with final bids due late in March. On March 25, 2014, it was reported that Sanofi SA was also interested in acquiring the target. On April 28, 2014, reports indicated that Merck & Co Inc was in the final stages of selling its consumer healthcare business with Bayer AG and Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc being the final contenders in the auction process. Moreover, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc confirmed that the company was in discussions with Merck & Co Inc for a possible offer for its consumer healthcare business. On April 30, 2014, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc confirmed that it was no longer in discussions for the consumer health business of Merck & Co Inc. On May 1, 2014, reports surfaced that Bayer AG was in exclusive talks to acquire the consumer healthcare business of Merck & Co. According to these reports, an announcement of the transaction was likely to happen in the next few days. Reports also cited that the consideration would include cash and exchange of assets. The transaction was originally expected to close by the second half of 2014. On June 18, 2014, Bayer AG obtained the US$14.2 billion syndicated loan comprised of US$12.2 billion bridge facility and a US$2 billion term loan, to fund the transaction.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$14,000,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$14,200,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$14,200,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$14,200,000,000

TARGET: Granar SA /Seed Business/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: Granar SA



LAST UPDATE: October 3, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 1, 2014



DEAL NO.: 802673


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, agreed to acquire the business and assets of the seed business of Granar SA for an undisclosed amount. With this acquisition, Bayer CropScience AG enters the soybean seed market in Paraguay for the first time bringing a complete range of solutions to farmers. The business to be acquired is located in Paraguay and breeds, produces, and markets improved soybean seeds.

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Algeta ASA 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Algeta ASA



LAST UPDATE: July 14, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 26, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 14, 2014



DEAL NO.: 771659


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

December 19, 2013

Closing Date:

March 14, 2014

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Algeta ASA for an increased offer of about NOK15.9 billion (US$2.6 billion) in cash. Under the terms of the revised offer, Bayer AG paid NOK362 (US$59) per share, up from an initial offer NOK336 (US$54.8) per share. The acquisition allowed Bayer AG to strengthen its oncology portfolio. The deal was subject to certain conditions and including a minimum acceptance level of 90%. The Board of Directors of Algeta ASA unanimously recommended the increased offer to the company's shareholders. The deal was expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2014. According to sources dated November 25, 2013, Bayer AG was rumored to be interested to acquire Algeta ASA and was willing to pay NOK306 (US$50.36) for every share in the target company. As of the rumor date, the parties declined to confirm or deny the deal. On November 26, 2013, Algeta ASA confirmed the talks with Bayer AG; however, the company noted that the offer price per Algeta ASA share was NOK336 (US$54.8) instead of the earlier announced NOK306 (US$49.9) per Algeta ASA share. Discussions were at an early stage and there is no guarantee that it will lead to an agreement. As of December 19, 2013, Bayer AG has received pre-acceptances representing 14% of the issued share capital of Algeta ASA. Algeta ASA is located in Oslo, Norway and engages in the development of products for the treatment of cancer. On January 6, 2014, the German Federal Cartel Office cleared the transaction. The offer commenced on January 20, 2014 and was set to close on February 24, 2014. On February 24, 2014, the offer was extended until February 26, 2014. Bayer AG already holds 92.2% of the share capital of Algeta ASA. Upon expiration of the offer on February 26, 2014, Bayer AG announced that 42,731,347 shares, representing 97.3% of the issued share capital of Algeta ASA was already tendered. As of March 6, 2014, the bidder already holds 43,131,641 shares or a 98.2% stake in the target company. Furthermore, Bayer AG also announced that it intends to initiate a compulsorily acquisition process for the remaining shares of Algeta ASA not yet tendered. On March 14, 2014, Thomas Ramdahl was appointed as the Managing Director of Algeta ASA upon the completion of the transaction.

Premium Offered:

.357

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$58.754788

Original Offer Price:

$2,191,058,000

Closing Offer Price:

$2,669,629,000

Price/Earnings:

37.179

Multiple of Book Value:

15.375

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$2,580,803,208

Total Invested Capital:

$2,580,803,000

Base Equity Price:

$2,580,803,208

TARGET: Radimetrics, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: April 10, 2014

EFFECTIVE DATE: November 26, 2012



DEAL NO.: 739670


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 26, 2012

Deal Description:

Bayer HealthCare AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Radimetrics Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Bayer HealthCare AG's portfolio of software solutions. As part of the transaction, all of the employees of Radimetrics Inc would join Bayer HealthCare AG. Founded in 2009, Radimetrics Inc is located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and develops healthcare software.

TARGET: Laboratorios BIAGRO SA 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: Laboratorios BIAGRO SA



LAST UPDATE: March 10, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 6, 2014



DEAL NO.: 781485


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG agreed to acquire Laboratorios BIAGRO SA for an undisclosed amount. The transaction expands Bayer CropScience AG global SeedGrowth business. The acquisition is subject to the approval of antitrust authority in Argentina. Founded in 1984, Laboratorios BIAGRO SA is located in Gral Las Heras, Buenos Aires, Argentina and produces and distributes biological seed treatments. It has 140 employees.

TARGET: FN Semillas SA 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: FN Semillas SA



LAST UPDATE: December 19, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 5, 2013



DEAL NO.: 772733


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, agreed to acquire FN Semillas SA for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would allow Bayer CropScience AG to enter into the soybean seed market in Argentina. The transaction would expand its customer base and market presence in Latin America. The deal will file for clearance before the Antitrust Authority in Argentina. Founded in 2010, FN Semillas SA is located in Salto, Buenos Aires, Argentina and produces and markets soybean seeds.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Schiff Nutrition International, Inc. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Healthcare LLC 
SELLER: Schiff Nutrition International, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: December 13, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 30, 2012



DEAL NO.: 737169


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

November 21, 2012

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer Healthcare LLC, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, terminated its merger agreement to acquire Schiff Nutrition International Inc for US$996.1 million in cash. Under the deal terms, Bayer Healthcare LLC would have paid US$34 in cash per share, representing a 46% premium to Schiff Nutrition's closing stock price on October 26, 2012. The deal would have enabled further growth for Bayer Healthcare LLC. Schiff Nutrition International Inc is located in Salt Lake City, Utah, and manufactures nutritional supplements with around 400 employees. The deal would have closed by the end of 2012 and was subject to customary closing conditions. On November 15, 2012, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc placed a bid to acquire Schiff Nutrition International Inc for approximately US$1.2 billion, offering US$42 cash for every target share. On November 20, 2012, Bayer Healthcare LLC announced that its offer still stands and that it will not raise its offer. On November 21, 2012, due to the superior offer of Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc, Schiff Nutrition International Inc terminated the agreement with Bayer Healthcare and paid US$22 million under the merger agreement.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$34 cash per share * 29,296,680 SHF os as of Sept 26, 2012

Premium Offered:

.446

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$34.000000

$996,087,000

Price/Earnings:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$996,087,120

Total Invested Capital:

$1,129,767,000

Base Equity Price:

$996,087,120

Seller Breakup Fee:

$22,000,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 30, 2013

Deal Description:

Eximium SAS, a subsidiary of Baulé SAS and ultimately owned by Bayer AG, acquired Voith Paper Fabrics SA from Voith GmbH for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 1967, Voith Paper Fabrics SA is located in Guissona, Catalonia, Spain and manufactures press and dryer fabrics.

TARGET: Conceptus, Inc. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Healthcare LLC 
SELLER: Conceptus, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 21, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 29, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 5, 2013



DEAL NO.: 753647


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 5, 2013

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer Healthcare LLC, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Conceptus Inc for US$1 billion in cash. Under the terms of the deal, the bidder offered to pay US$31 cash per target share. The acquisition augments the bidder's birth control product offerings, particularly in the US market. Conceptus Inc is located in Mountain View, California, United States and develops and markets minimally invasive devices for reproductive medical applications. It employs 300 people. The deal was subject customary closing conditions, including anti-trust approvals. On May 7, 2013, Bayer Healthcare announced that the offer period started, which was stated to last until June 5, 2013. On May 29, 2013, it was announced that the US Federal Trade Commission has cleared the deal. On June 5, 2013, it was announced that at the close of the offer, 31,983,536 shares representing a 96.4% stake in the target have been validly tendered. On the same day, Bayer Healthcare exercised its top-up option, consummating the merger.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$31 cash * 32,542,457 CPTS o/s as of April 22, 2013

Premium Offered:

.222

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 30, 1998

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Chirons Diagnostic Unit for $1.1 billion in cash. The acquisition makes Bayer the fourth biggest company in the $19 billion global market for medical test kits. The Chiron unit has 3,000 employees in MA, OH, and CA, as well as the UK.

TARGET: Melhoramento Agropastoril Ltda. /Soy Germplasm Bank/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: Melhoramento Agropastoril Ltda.



LAST UPDATE: April 16, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 6, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 6, 2013



DEAL NO.: 749559


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 6, 2013

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the business and assets of soy germplasm bank, from Melhoramento Agropastoril Ltda for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances Bayer CropScience AG's soybean business, and also expands its market presence in Latin America. In a separate but related transaction, Bayer CropScience AG also agreed to acquire Wehrtec and the soy business of Agricola Wehrmann Ltda. The acquired business manufactures and distributes pesticides, and vegetable seeds.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Description:

Manufactures and distributes pesticides, and vegetable seeds

TARGET: Wehrtec Tecnologia Agricola Ltda.

SELLER: Agricola Wehrmann Ltda



LAST UPDATE: March 11, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 6, 2013



DEAL NO.: 749560


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, agreed to acquire Wehrtec Tecnologia Agricola Ltda, a subsidiary of Agricola Wehrmann Ltda for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances Bayer CropScience AG's soybean business, and also expands its market presence in Latin America. Wehrtec Tecnologia Agricola Ltda is based in Brazil and engages in the breeding of soybeans, corn, sorghum, potatoes and garlic.

TARGET: PROPHYTA Biologischer Pflanzenschutz GmbH 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: PROPHYTA Biologischer Pflanzenschutz GmbH



LAST UPDATE: February 13, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 8, 2013



DEAL NO.: 744105


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a unit of Bayer AG, agreed to acquire PROPHYTA Biologischer Pflanzenschutz GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition expands Bayer CropScience AG's product portfolio, strengthening its fruits and vegetables business activities. PROPHYTA Biologischer Pflanzenschutz GmbH, founded in 1992 and located in Malchow, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Germany, develops, produces and markets biological plant protection products and employs 30 people. The transaction is expected to be completed in the coming weeks.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

PROPHYTA Biologischer Pflanzenschutz GmbH

Country:

Industry:

Drugs, Medical Supplies & Equipment

Description:

Develops, produces and markets biological plant protection products

TARGET: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. /US Animal Health Bus/ 
BUYER: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. / Bayer AG / Bayer Healthcare LLC 
SELLER: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. /US Animal Health Bus/



LAST UPDATE: January 25, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 14, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 3, 2013



DEAL NO.: 732852


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 3, 2013

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer Healthcare LLC, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the business and assets of the US animal health operations of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd for up to US$145 million in cash and contingent payout. As per the terms, Bayer Healthcare LLC would pay US$60 million in upfront payment and US$85 million, subject to certain manufacturing and sales milestones. The acquisition enables the bidder to expand its animal health operations in the United States. The target business unit manufactures and supplies animal food products, and employs approximately 300 people. The deal, pending antitrust clearance and other closing conditions, was expected to close in 2013.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$145,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$145,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$60,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$145,000,000

Contingent Payment Amount:

$85,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$145,000,000

TARGET: Abbott & Cobb, Inc. /Watermelon & Melon Seed Business/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: Abbott & Cobb, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: November 21, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 12, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 2, 2012



DEAL NO.: 723747


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 2, 2012

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the watermelon and melon seed business of Abbott & Cobb Inc for US$ 53 million. The transaction will enable Bayer CropScience AG to increase its own seed portfolio and to profit from the forecasted growth of the vegetable seed market. Around 30 of the acquired business' employees would be absorbed by Bayer. The business for acquisition is based in Pennsylvania, United States, and produces watermelon and melon seeds. On June 16, 2012, it was announced that the deal was expected to be completed within a few weeks.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$53,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$53,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$53,000,000

TARGET: KMG Chemicals, Inc. /Animal Health Bus/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Healthcare LLC 
SELLER: KMG Chemicals, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 16, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 16, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 1, 2012



DEAL NO.: 711990


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 1, 2012

Deal Description:

Bayer Healthcare LLC, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired business and assets of KMG Chemicals Inc's animal health business for US$10.2 million. The acquisition, expected to close before 31 March 2012, is part of Bayer Healthcare's strategy to strengthen its animal health portfolio. Also, the consideration includes US$1 million in escrow. The acquired business manufactures and distributes specialty chemicals for animal healthcare, and has reported sales of US$11.4 million in 2011.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 725940


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 16, 2012

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired AgraQuest Inc for US$425 million. The transaction enhances Bayer CropScience AG's its fruits and vegetables business. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions and approval by authorities. AgraQuest Inc has around 250 employees. AgraQuest Inc is based in Davis, California, and develops pesticides and provides best management services.

TARGET: Baulé SAS 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: Eximium SAS



LAST UPDATE: July 20, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 30, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 30, 2012



DEAL NO.: 716387


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 30, 2012

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the remaining 50% stake not already owned in Baulé SAS, from its joint venture partner Eximium SAS for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances Bayer MaterialScience AG's product portfolio and also expands its market presence. Following the acquisition, Dr. Wilhelm Lamberts, current Bayer MaterialScience Oldenburg GmbH & Co KG managing director, became president of Baulé SAS. Baulé SAS's employees would join with Bayer MaterialScience AG. Founded in 2008, Baulé SAS is based in Romans, Centre, France, and manufactures and supplies polyurethanes products. It has 139 employees.

Percent Owned Before:

50.000%

Percent Sought:

50.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience LLC subsidiary of Bayer AG agreed to acquire the business and assets of Polycarbonate Sheet Business from Arkema SA for an undisclosed amount. The transaction expands the company's product portfolio. The acquisition also includes products Tuffak, used in aerospace equipments. Polycarbonate Sheet Business is based in United States and manufactures vinyl products.

TARGET: BayOne Urethane Systems LLC 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience LLC 
SELLER: PolyOne Corp.



LAST UPDATE: February 20, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 30, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 30, 2011



DEAL NO.: 567491


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 30, 2011

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience LLC, a unit of Bayer AG, acquired the remaining 50% stake in BayOne Urethane Systems LLC from PolyOne Corp for US$19.3 million in cash. The transaction stems from the plans of PolyOne Corp to reposition its current business portfolio. BayOne Urethane Systems LLC is a joint-venture company between PolyOne Corp and Bayer AG. Based in St Louis, United states, BayOne Urethane Systems LLC develops, manufactures and distributes polymers.

50.000%

Percent Sought:

32 of 122 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2011 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Schering AG 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Schering AG



LAST UPDATE: December 29, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 23, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 20, 2006



DEAL NO.: 368855


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 20, 2006

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

German pharmaceuticals giant Bayer AG acquired a 78.2% majority stake Schering AG for EUR86 (US$102.5) per share in cash. Thus, the total consideration for the transaction amounts to about EUR13.1 billion (US$16.8 billion). Schering AG is a Germany based manufacturer of pharmaceuticals and diagnostic substances. The company, which had just received a hostile takeover bid from German pharmaceutical manufacturer Merck KGaA on March 13, 2006, welcomed Bayer's proposal and has stated its intention to approve the offer and recommend acceptance by the company's stockholders, according to a statement by the business. Bayer AG's Management Board Chairman Werner Wenning said that the takeover of Schering AG is in line with Bayer's strategic objective to further grow its health care business, especially in the area of pharmaceutical specialty products. On May 25, 2006, the Competition Commission approved the transaction. On June 14, 2006, Bayer AG agreed to acquire the remaining 21.8% stake in Schering AG from Merck KGaA at an increased offer price of EUR89 (US$114.3) per share. The deal allows Bayer AG to go through with its original offer.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 194,200,000 Schering AG s/o * 78.2% * EUR86 = 13,060,338,400. related deal #367463.

Premium Offered:

.416

Percent Sought:

78.200%

$16,421,168,000

Price/Earnings:

26.765

6.451

Terms:

Method of Payment:

Cash

$16,030,558,000

Base Equity Price:

$15,651,023,693

TARGET: Raps GbR /Oilseed Rape Business/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: P. H. Petersen Saatzucht Lundsgaard GmbH & Co. KG



LAST UPDATE: October 7, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 7, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 7, 2011



DEAL NO.: 602508


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 7, 2011

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the business and assets of the Oilseed Rape business of Raps GbR, a subsidiary of P. H. Petersen Saatzucht Lundsgaard GmbH & Co KG for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition includes all available breeding materials and products of Raps GbR that are in the market. The acquisition would strengthen the oilseed rape breeding business of Bayer CropScience AG and further expand its business in the European oilseed rape market. The acquired Oilseed Rape business of Raps GbR breeds and supplies spring and winter oilseed rape.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Pathway Medical Technologies, Inc.

EFFECTIVE DATE: September 1, 2011



DEAL NO.: 598326


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 1, 2011

Deal Description:

MEDRAD Inc, a subsidiary of Bayer HealthCare AG, itself ultimately owned by Bayer AG, acquired Pathway Medical Technologies Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction would strengthen the position of MEDRAD Inc in the field of vascular intervention technologies. Based in Kirkland, Washington, Pathway Medical Technologies Inc manufactures, develops and markets medical devices for treatment of arterial disease.

Based in New Zealand and founded in 1958, Bomac Laboratories Ltd manufactures animal health products.

TARGET: Topsun Technology & Science Qidong /OTC Cough & Cold/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer HealthCare /Consumer Care Division/ 
SELLER: Topsun Technology & Science Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: January 28, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 25, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 1, 2010



DEAL NO.: 395814


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer HealthCare Consumer Care Division, which belongs to Bayer HealthCare AG, acquired the entire business and assets of the Western Over-the-Counter Cough & Cold Portfolio from Topsun Technology & Science Qidong Gaitianli Pharmaceutical Co Ltd, a subsidiary of Shanghai-listed Topsun Technology & Science Co Ltd, for approximately RMB1.1 billion (US$135.7 million). Based in Qidong, Jiangsu Province, the target includes a manufacturing facility located in Qidong, a national sales force and distribution network associated with the brands. The Cough & Cold Portfolio generated approximately RMB331 million (US$41 million) in sales of the year 2005. Considering China is one of the fastest growing markets of OTC medicines in the world, the acquisition would strengthen the bidder's presence there.

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 16, 2008

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer HealthCare AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired DIREVO Biotech AG for EUR210 million (US$298 million) in cash. DIREVO Biotech AG is a German research company that specializes in the research of proteins and bio-molecules as well as bioengineered products and processes for the industrial and pharmaceutical markets. The acquisition of DIREVO Biotech AG does not include the company's wholly owned subsidiary DIREVO Industrial Biotechnology GmbH, which has been sold in a separate deal to a group of financial investors.

TARGET: Possis Medical, Inc. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / MEDRAD, Inc. 
SELLER: Possis Medical, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: May 7, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 11, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 3, 2008



DEAL NO.: 459007


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 3, 2008

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

MEDRAD Inc, part of Bayer HealthCare AG, which is a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Possis Medical Inc, via a cash tender offer for approximately US$332.2 million. Under the terms of the agreement, each share of Possis Medical Inc was tendered for US$19.50. This represents about a 36% premium over Possis Medical Inc's February 8, 2007 close price of US$14.35. Possis Medical Inc is a medical device manufacturer that develops a product which removes intra-vascular blood clots. With the acquisition, MEDRAD Inc continues its commitment to the treatment of patients in the growing cardiovascular intervention field.

Transaction Notes:

BE = cash (17,034,157 POSS shares outstanding as of 8-Feb-08 * US$19.50)

Premium Offered:

.414

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$19.500000

Original Offer Price:

$332,166,000

Closing Offer Price:

$332,166,000

Price/Earnings:

420.463

Multiple of Book Value:

4.329

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$332,166,062

Total Invested Capital:

$332,166,000

Base Equity Price:

$332,166,062

Seller Breakup Fee:

$11,100,000

Name:

Possis Medical, Inc.

ANNUAL RESULTS

TARGET: Artificial Muscle, Inc. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience LLC 
SELLER: Artificial Muscle, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 9, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 9, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 9, 2010



DEAL NO.: 538629


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 9, 2010

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience LLC, a subsidiary of Bayer MaterialScience AG and ultimately owned by Bayer AG, acquired Artificial Muscle Inc for an undisclosed amount. Pursuant to the acquisition, all employees of Artificial Muscle Inc, including Scott Metcalf, its President and Chief Executive Officer, will be retained. The acquisition provides an opportunity for Bayer MaterialScience LLC to expand into a new market sector. It also strengthens Bayer MaterialScience LLC's position as a solution provider. Based in Sunnyvale, California, Artificial Muscle Inc designs and manufactures actuator and sensing components.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Artificial Muscle, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Electronics

Description:

Designs and manufactures actuator and sensing components

TARGET: Athenix Corp. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG 
SELLER: Athenix Corp.



LAST UPDATE: January 15, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 19, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 2, 2009



DEAL NO.: 521208


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 2, 2009

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Athenix Corp for US$400 million. Under the acquisition terms, Bayer CropScience AG paid US$400 million which includes up to US$35 million upon achievement of certain development milestones. As a result of the transaction, Bayer CropScience AG was able to boost its technological platform. Athenix Corp is a biotechnology company engaging in herbicide tolerance and insect control platforms for corn and soybeans.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$400,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$400,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$400,000,000

Contingent Payment Amount:

$35,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$400,000,000

Name:

Athenix Corp.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Chemicals, Paints & Coatings

Description:

Develops agricultural herbicide tolerance and insect control chemicals

TARGET: PolyBioMed Ltd 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: Lombard Medical PLC



LAST UPDATE: November 30, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 17, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 30, 2009



DEAL NO.: 527902


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 30, 2009

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired PolyBioMed Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Lombard Medical Plc, for GBP1 million (US$1.7 million) in cash. The acquisition will help Bayer MaterialScience AG expand its product portfolio for medical technology and will give them access to application areas such as coronary drug-eluting stents plus catheter systems for interventional cardiology, urology and neurology. PolyBioMed Ltd was founded in 1996 and is based in Sheffield, United Kingdom. It develops polymer chemistry to modify surface properties of devices for medical and non-medical applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,680,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,641,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,679,550

Total Invested Capital:

$1,680,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,679,550

Name:

PolyBioMed Ltd

Country:

United Kingdom

Exchange:

London Stock Exchange

Industry:

Miscellaneous Services

Description:

Develops polymer chemistry to modify surface properties of devices for medical and non-medical applications

TARGET: Bayer Polymers (Shanghai) Co. Ltd. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: Shanghai Chlor-Alkali Chemical Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: April 16, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 15, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 15, 2009



DEAL NO.: 510337


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 15, 2009

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG won an auction and acquired the remaining 10% of Bayer Polymers (Shanghai) Co Ltd from Shanghai Chlor-Alkali Chemical Co Ltd for RMB230 million (US$33.7 million) in cash. Based in Shanghai, the target is primarily engaged in the manufacture of polycarbonate, polymers and other related plastic products.

TARGET: Monochem SA 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: The Carlyle Group LLC



LAST UPDATE: April 15, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 1, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 1, 2009



DEAL NO.: 510285


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 1, 2009

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Monochem SA, a subsidiary of Neochimiki SA and ultimately owned by The Carlyle Group LLC, for an undisclosed amount. Monochem SA produces polyurethane insulating materials, industrial floorings and chemical auxiliary materials for the tanning and textile industry. The acquisition expands Bayer MaterialScience AG's systems house business in southeast Europe.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Monochem SA

Country:

Greece

Industry:

Description:

Produces polyurethane insulating materials, industrial floorings and chemical auxiliary materials for the tanning and textile industry

EFFECTIVE DATE: March 31, 2009



DEAL NO.: 509373


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 31, 2009

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience SA acquired the assets and business of the crop protection operation from Agrogreen Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquired asset is the manufacturing and distribution operation of biological pesticides including Agrogreen's major product line called BioNem.

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 9, 2001

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired the remianing 49% stake it did not already own in its joint venture Bayer Sanmar Ltd from Sanmar Group for an undisclosed amount. The joint venture was formed in 1996 and manufactures thermoplastic polyurethanes.

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: BaySystems BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co. KG 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: Büsing & Fasch GmbH & Co. KG



LAST UPDATE: January 20, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 21, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 21, 2008



DEAL NO.: 471873


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 21, 2008

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the remaining 50% in BaySystems BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co KG from Büsing & Fasch GmbH & Co KG for an undisclosed sum. BaySystems BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co KG specializes in the manufacture of foams and elastomers. BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co KG, originally a subsidiary of Büsing & Fasch GmbH & Co KG, was in 2003 re-organized into a joint-venture business between Bayer MaterialScience AG and Büsing & Fasch GmbH & Co KG. In the beginning of 2006, BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co KG changed its name to BaySystems BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co KG.

Percent Owned Before:

50.000%

Percent Sought:

50.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

BaySystems BÜFA Polyurethane GmbH & Co. KG

Country:

Germany

Industry:

Chemicals, Paints & Coatings

Description:

Manufactures integral foams, elastomers and rigid foam


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * BUYER DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Bayer AG

Cross-Reference:

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

June 3, 2008

Deal Description:

Bayer Healthcare LLC, which is a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the business and assets of Sagmel Inc's over-the counter business for an undisclosed amount. Bayer Healthcare LLC provides healthcare and laboratory testing services while Sagmel Inc's over-the counter business manufactures pharmaceuticals in Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, and Ukraine.

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Schering AG 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Merck KGaA



LAST UPDATE: April 30, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 14, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 17, 2007



DEAL NO.: 377752


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 17, 2007

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer AG agreed to acquire a 21.8% minority stake in Schering AG from Merck KGaA for EUR89.36 (US$114.39) per share in cash. Thus, the total consideration for the stake amounts to about EUR3.78 billion (US$4.84 billion). The acquisition allows Bayer AG to go through with its original public offer for Schering AG from March 2006, under which Bayer AG agreed to purchase Schering AG for EUR86 (US$103.1) per share in cash. As a result of the increased offer price for Merck KGaA's 21.8% stake in Schering AG, Bayer AG will withdraw the suit filed against Merck in New York on June 13, 2006. As of November 8, 2006 Bayer AG said it will offer EUR89.36 (US$113.98) a share for nay remaining stakes. Any Schering AG shareholders who don't sell their shares will receive a net annual guaranteed dividend of EUR3.62 (US$4.62) per share. According to a statement by Bayer AG, the company owns as of July 12, 2006 a total of 92.4% in Schering AG. As of 17 January, Bayer AG holds a 96.2% percent stake in Schering AG and plans to squeeze-out the remaining minority shareholders.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 194,200,000 Schering s/o * 21.8% * EUR89.36 = EUR3,767,868,400.

Premium Offered:

0.042

Percent Owned Before:

78.200%

Percent Sought:

21.800%

Share Price:

$114.001

Original Offer Price:

$4,754,121,000

Closing Offer Price:

$4,826,302,000

Price/Earnings:

27.810

Multiple of Book Value:

6.703

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$4,826,301,754

Total Invested Capital:

$4,884,751,000

Base Equity Price:

$4,826,302,000

Schering AG

Country:

LAST UPDATE: April 17, 2008

EFFECTIVE DATE: September 29, 2004



DEAL NO.: 314654


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

September 29, 2004

Deal Description:

Bayer Technology Services GmbH, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the business and assets of Ehrfeld Mikrotechnik GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will allow Bayer Technology to offer a full range of services from module development through process and product development to the engineering and construction of entire production units. The company will be renamed Ehrfeld Mikrotechnik BTS GmbH and become a subsidiary of Bayer Technology Services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Bayer AG /Natural Substances Division/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG /Natural Substances Division/ /Mgmt & Employees/ 
SELLER: Bayer AG



LAST UPDATE: March 16, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 28, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 28, 2006



DEAL NO.: 373053


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Unit Management. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

April 28, 2006

Deal Description:

A private group led by the management and employees of Bayer AG's Natural Substances Division acquired the business and assets of the division for an undisclosed price. The Natural Substances Division of Germany based Bayer AG specializes in the research and development of new products on its own account and for customers in the pharmaceuticals, agrochemicals, and food industries. Following the acquisition, the division will be renamed InterMed Discovery and be located to Dortmund, Germany in mid 2006.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Country:

Germany

Exchange:

Other

Industry:

Miscellaneous Services

Description:

Researches and develops new products on its own account and for customers in the pharmaceuticals, agrochemicals, and food industries

TARGET: Paragon Seed, Inc. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Nunhems BV 
SELLER: Paragon Seed, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: December 12, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 12, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 12, 2007



DEAL NO.: 450717


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 12, 2007

Deal Description:

Nunhems BV, a subsidiary of Bayer CropScience AG, which is part of Bayer AG, acquired Paragon Seed Inc for an undisclosed amount. Paragon Seed Inc is a producer of lettuce, which had sales of $8US.5 million in 2006. With Paragon, Nunhems BV can strengthen its position in the US lettuce seed market.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Closing Date:

December 15, 1999

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer, through its Bayer Diagnostics subsidiary, acquired Oncogene from OSI Pharmaceuticals for $9.75 million in cash plus $1.25 million in contingent payment. The deal will compliment Bayers expertise in commercializing assays across testing platforms.

TARGET: Brahe as 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: TP Holding as



LAST UPDATE: September 10, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 27, 2007



DEAL NO.: 438130


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

German polymer company Bayer MaterialScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, agreed to acquire Czech polyurethane maker Brahe as from TP Holding as for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition reflects the increasing importance of the growing markets of Central and Eastern Europe. The transaction is expected to be completed in the fourth quarter in 2007. Bayer and Brahe have been cooperating since the 1960s. Brahe as will be renamed to BaySystems CentralEurope as.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: July 13, 2007

EFFECTIVE DATE: July 13, 2007



DEAL NO.: 430884


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 13, 2007

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, has acquired South Korean vegetable seed company, SeedEx, for an undisclosed amount. SeedEx specializes in the breeding, production and marketing of Hot pepper and Brassica varieties. The acquisition is expected to strengthen Nunhems, a vegetable seed division of Bayer CropScience, by offering access to new Asian markets.

100.000%

Not disclosed

TARGET: Taiwan Ure-Tech Co. Ltd. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer MaterialScience AG 
SELLER: Taiwan Ure-Tech Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: July 2, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 23, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 1, 2007



DEAL NO.: 395365


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2007

Deal Description:

Bayer MaterialScience AG, a polymer materials developer and a subsidiary of publicly-listed pharmaceutical and chemical conglomerate Bayer AG, acquired 100% stake in Taiwan Ure-Tech Co Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Based in Taiwan, Ure-Tech is one of the largest thermoplastic polyurethane materials producers in the Asia Pacific region; the company posted sales of approximately TWD 1.8 billion (US$ 55.0 million) in 2005. This acquisition allowed the bidder to become the world's largest supplier and solutions provider of thermoplastic polyurethane resins and films.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

TARGET: Stoneville Pedigreed Seed Co. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer CropScience AG

LAST UPDATE: June 19, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 31, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 19, 2007



DEAL NO.: 424481


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 19, 2007

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience AG, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Stoneville Pedigreed Seed Co from Monsanto Co for approximately US$310 million. Stoneville Pedigreed Seed, based in Memphis, Tennessee, produces and markets cotton planting seeds. The acquisition is expected to strengthen the position of the rapidly growing US cotton seed business of BayerCropScience.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Vertical

Closing Date:

February 20, 2007

Deal Description:

Bayer HealthCare AG, which is a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired Pharmonyx Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Since 1999 Pharmonyx Ltd has been both providing marketing services and distributing Bayer HealthCare AG's products in Russia, Belarus, Ukraine, and Kazakhstan. Bayer HealthCare AG will also gain 219 employees from Pharmonyx Ltd as a result of this transaction.

TARGET: Metrika, Inc. 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Healthcare LLC

LAST UPDATE: September 11, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 6, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 6, 2006



DEAL NO.: 379871


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Vertical

Closing Date:

July 6, 2006

Deal Description:

Bayer HealthCare LLC, a member of Bayer AG, acquired privately-held Metrika Inc for an undisclosed sum. Based in Sunnyvale, CA, Metrika manufactures and markets A1CNow+(R), a meter-based diabetes monitoring system that has single-use, disposable test cartridges.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

TARGET: Jiangsu Qidong Gaitianli Medicines Co. Ltd. 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Topsun Technology & Science Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: May 16, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 15, 2006



DEAL NO.: 374711


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Bayer AG, the second largest pharmaceutical firm in Europe, agreed to acquire a 54.5% majority stake in Jiangsu Qidong Gaitianli Medicines Co Ltd from Topsun Technology & Science Co Ltd for approximately RMB 1.3 billion (US$ 163.8 million). Based in Jiangsu province, the target is currently a wholly-owned subsidiary of Shanghai-listed pharmaceutical firm Topsun Technology & Science. Qidong Gaitianli is one of the largest over-the-counter medicine producers in China. Bayer will also acquire four of Qidong Gaitianli's OTC brands and related sales departments. This acquisition will allow the bidder to strengthen its pharmaceutical operations in China.

Percent Sought:

54.510%

Original Offer Price:

$163,752,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$163,752,000

Base Equity Price:

$163,752,000

TARGET: Icon Genetics AG 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Innovation GmbH 
SELLER: Icon Genetics AG



LAST UPDATE: January 12, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 11, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 11, 2006



DEAL NO.: 361241


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 11, 2006

Deal Description:

Bayer Innovation GmbH, a subsidiary of German pharmaceutical company Bayer AG, acquired Icon Genetics AG for an undisclosed price. Icon Genetics AG is also a German company that specializes in plant engineering technologies and develops processes for the biotechnological production of biopharmaceuticals. The acquisition will strengthen Bayer's activities aimed at producing specific pharmaceutical substances in plants, according to a statement by Dow Jones.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Aventis Cropscience 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Aventis SA



LAST UPDATE: July 22, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 2, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 3, 2002



DEAL NO.: 157261


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 3, 2002

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Aventis Cropscience from Aventis SA and Schering AG for EUR7.25 billion (GB£4.5 billion, US$6.6 billion) including the assumption of debt, of which Schering will receive EUR1.5 billion (GB£938.6m, US$1.36bn) for its stake. Under the terms of the deal, Bayer will acquire a 76% stake from Aventis SA, and the remaining 24% stake from Schering AG. Aventis Cropscience will be integrated into Bayer and renamed Bayer Cropscience. The deal was funded by way of a EUR6bn (GB£3.72bn) revolving credit facility lead arranged by Bank of America Securities, Deutsche Bank and JP Morgan.

Transaction Notes:

Advisor list, 8 Oct 01. KW. Sharon added expected close date-25/10/01 per Reuters

100.000%

$6,638,835,000

$6,638,835,000

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$6,638,835,000

$6,638,835,000

TARGET: Roche Holding Ltd. /OTC Drugs Unit/ 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Roche Holding AG



LAST UPDATE: June 16, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 19, 2004 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 1, 2005



DEAL NO.: 306436


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 1, 2005

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Roche Holding Ltd's over-the-counter (OTC) drugs unit for US$2.94 billion. The acquisition includes Roche Consumer Health, Roche's stake in a US OTC joint venture with Bayer, and five Roche OTC production sites in Germany, France, Argentina, Morocco and Indonesia. The expanded OTC company will have 6,700 employees in 120 countries and anticipated annual sales of EUR2.4 billion (US$2.95 billion). Bayer expects the acquisition to significantly strengthen its existing position in the OTC drugs market. In addition, Bayer expects annual synergies of EUR100 to 120 million (US$123 to 148 million) from the deal to be realized over the next three years. On the 19th November 2004, the European Union Commission approved Bayer AG's takeover of Roche Holding AG's units.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$2,940,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$2,940,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$2,940,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$2,940,000,000

TARGET: Zeptosens AG 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Technology Services GmbH 
SELLER: Zeptosens AG



LAST UPDATE: March 9, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 9, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 9, 2005



DEAL NO.: 330451


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 9, 2005

Deal Description:

Bayer Technology Services GmbH, a subsidiary of Bayer AG, acquired the Swiss Zeptosens AG in order to strengthen its expertise in the field of highly sensitive detection processes for life sciences. Financial details about the acquisition were not disclosed. Zeptosens AG specializes in the development of microarray systems and detection technologies enabling ultra-sensitive analysis of biomolecules. The company's microarray systems are used by both the pharmaceutical industry and universities for genome and proteome research.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Zeptosens AG

Country:

Switzerland

Industry:

Description:

Develops and commercializes microarray systems and detection technologies enabling ultra-sensitive analysis of biomolecules

TARGET: Worldwide Polyols Business 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Polymers LLC 
SELLER: Lyondell Chemical Co.



LAST UPDATE: January 11, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 16, 1999 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 3, 2000



DEAL NO.: 44270


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 3, 2000

Deal Description:

Bayer acquired the worldwide polyols business of Lyondell Chemical for $2.45 billion to help boost profit at its largest division. The acquisition includes operations in West Virginia, Texas, Belgium, France, Indonesia, and Taiwan. Lyondell will use the proceeds to reduce debt.

Transaction Notes:

Closed by AT. CCN Matthews, AT.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$2,450,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$2,450,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$2,450,000,000

TARGET: Gustafson LLC 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Cropscience India Ltd. 
SELLER: Gustafson LLC



LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 22, 2004 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 31, 2004



DEAL NO.: 268704


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 31, 2004

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer CropScience LP, a subsidiary of Bayer CropScience, itself a subsidiary of Bayer AG, agreed to acquire the 50% stake in Gustafson LLC owned by Crompton Corp for US$124 million in cash. Gustafson manufactures and markets seed treatment products and related equipment. It employs approximately 250 people and generated revenue of approximately US$130 million in 2003. The acquisition gives Bayer CropScience, which already holds a 50% share of Gustafson, full ownership of the seed treatment business in the US, Canada, and Mexico.

Transaction Notes:

Closed by GK

Percent Owned Before:

50.000%

Percent Sought:

50.000%

Original Offer Price:

$124,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$124,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$124,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$124,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$124,000,000

TARGET: Sewon Enterprise Co Ltd 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Sewon Enterprise Co Ltd



LAST UPDATE: September 19, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 29, 2000 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 29, 2000



DEAL NO.: 128257


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 29, 2000

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Sewon Enterprise Co. Ltd, for an undisclosed price. Sewon Enterprise Co. Ltd will be trading under the name Bayer Sewon Ltd. in Kimhae, Pusan. Sewons product portfolio primarily includes solid sheets made from polycarbonate (PC), but also encompasses polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) and polyvinyl chloride (PVC) sheet. Sewon Enterprise Co. Ltd. posted sales of EUR 18m (GB£ 11.24m) in 1999 and has approximately 60 employees. Prior to the transaction Sewon Enterprise Co Ltd was a privately owned company.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Pursell Industries Inc 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Pursell Industries Inc



LAST UPDATE: September 8, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 6, 1998 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 9, 1999



DEAL NO.: 218322


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 9, 1999

Deal Description:

Bayer AG acquired Pursell Industries for an undisclosed amount. The combined company will offer consumers an extended line of fertilizers and garden products under the Bayer name. Pursell has strong experience in consumer markets and holds a respected position in the US lawn and garden segment. This acquisition marks Bayers entrance into the $1.3 billion market for pesticides and with the combined strengths of Bayer and Pursell, consumers will gain the best products available.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Pursell Industries Inc

Country:

United States

Description:

Makes fertilizers for lawn, garden, and food plants

TARGET: Makroform GmbH 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Makroform GmbH



LAST UPDATE: August 4, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 25, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 25, 2003



DEAL NO.: 208620


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 25, 2003

Deal Description:

Bayer AG announced its acquisition of the remaining 45.5% interest in Makroform GmbH, a joint venture that was originally formed in 2000 between Bayer AG and Roehm GmbH, a subsidiary of Degussa AG. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. The acquisition will enable Bayer Polymers, a subgroup of Bayer AG, to strengthen its position as a leading manufacturer of polycarbonate plastic sheeting.

Percent Owned Before:

54.500%

Percent Sought:

45.500%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

September 1, 2000

Under the terms of the deal, Bayer AG acquired an undisclosed amount of shares at 215 pence each in PPL Therapeutics and will fund the development of a product which can be used against cystic fibrosis and genetic lung disease.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 1, 2000

Deal Description:

Bayer Crop Protection, the agribusiness division of Bayer AG, acquired the FLINT fungicide business, including the production facilities in Muttenz, Switzerland, as well as associated property rights, of Novartis Crop Protection, the agribusiness division of Novartis AG, for CHF1.3 billion (US$753.4 million). FLINT is a second-generation strobilurin fungicide with a broad spectrum of applications.

TARGET: Visible Genetics Inc 
BUYER: Bayer AG / Bayer Diagnostics Corp. 
SELLER: Visible Genetics Inc



LAST UPDATE: January 30, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 23, 2002 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 10, 2002



DEAL NO.: 175154


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 10, 2002

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Bayer Diagnostics, a division of Bayer AG, acquired Visible Genetics for $CDN43.7 million in cash (US$28.8 million). This acquisition is consistent with the strategy of Bayer Diagnostics to expand its Infectious Disease portfolio and strengthen its position within the nucleic acid diagnostic segment of the professional laboratory market. In addition, this acquisition will enable Visible Genetics to develop and grow its sequencing technology. Visible Genetics has 350 employees.

Transaction Notes:

BE= $1.50 per share x 19,197,191 o/s. Advisor list, 15 Oct 02, KW.

Premium Offered:

0.916

100.000%

$1.502

SELLER: Tectrade AS



LAST UPDATE: November 13, 2002 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 25, 2002 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 31, 2002



DEAL NO.: 171795


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 31, 2002

Deal Description:

Bayer AG, Leverkusen, Nordrhein-Westfalen (North Rhine-Westphalia), Germany, a research-based company with major businesses in healthcare, agriculture, polymers and chemicals, will acquire the polyurethanes activities of Tectrade A/S, Vedbaek (Copenhagen), Denmark, a supplier of machines and turn key production plants for the polyurethane processing industry.

Transaction Notes:

( Currency; German Marks : U.S. Dollars 1:0.441481 )

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Aliphatic Diisocyanates Business of Lyondell Chemical Co 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Lyondell Chemical Co.



LAST UPDATE: April 29, 2002 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 20, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 31, 2001



DEAL NO.: 157554


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 31, 2001

Deal Description:

Bayer acquired the assets of the aliphatic diisocyanates business of Lyondell Chemical for an undisclosed amount. The aliphatic isocyanate products include hexamethylene diisocyanate, isophore diisocyanate, and aliphatic polyisocyanates, which are used to manufacture polyurethane coatings.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: July 16, 2001
