EFFECTIVE DATE: July 13, 2001



DEAL NO.: 151677


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 13, 2001

Deal Description:

Bayer AG, Leverkusen, Nordrhein-Westfalen (North Rhine-Westphalia), Germany, a manufacturer of chemicals, acquired a further 16% stake in PPL Therapeutics Ltd, Roslin, Midlothian, Scotland, a company engaged in the bio-production of commercially valuable protiens. Under the terms of the deal Bayer AG is guaranteeing a GB£15m bank loan, from Royal Bank of Scotland, to PPL Therapeutics.

Percent Sought:

16.000%

Original Offer Price:

$21,096,000

Closing Offer Price:

$21,096,000

Terms:

Available

$21,096,000

$21,096,000

Copyright 2001 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Innogenetics NV 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Innogenetics NV



LAST UPDATE: March 16, 2001 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 15, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 15, 2001



DEAL NO.: 142311


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 15, 2001

Deal Description:

Bayer AG, Leverkusen, Nordrhein-Westfalen (North Rhien Westphalia), Germany, a research based company active in the healthcare, agriculture, polymers and speciality chemicals group, acquired a stake of approximately 2% in Innogenetics NV, Zwijnaarde, Belgium, a biotechnology group. Consideration Euro10m (GB£6.34m). At the same time, Bayer also acquired the exclusive worldwide sale and marketing rights of LiPA HIV and LiPA HCV products, two diagnostics products developed by Innogenetics, to diagnose sufferers of the HIV virus and Hepatitis C respectively, for an initial price of Euro10.4m (GB£6.59m). Bayer agreed to pay a future milestone payment of an undisclosed sum, plus research and development funding for the products over the next five years, and will pay Innogenetics a percentage of the sale price.

Percent Sought:

2.000%

Original Offer Price:

$9,222,000

Closing Offer Price:

$9,222,000

Terms:

TARGET: Curagen Corp. 
BUYER: Bayer AG 
SELLER: Curagen Corp.



LAST UPDATE: January 17, 2001 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 17, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 17, 2001



DEAL NO.: 137826


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 17, 2001

Deal Description:

Bayer AG, Leverkusen, Nordrhein-Westfalen (North Rhine-Westphalia), Germany, the research-based company with major businesses in health care, agriculture, polymers and specialty chemicals, acquired a 7% stake CuraGen Corporation, New Haven, CT, USA, a company involved in the development of pharmaceutical and life science products through the systematic application of genomics, as part of an expandable, five-year pharmacogenomic and toxicogenomic collaboration between the two companies. Total consideration US$ 124m (GB£ 83.07m) , which includes US$ 85m (GB£ 56.94m) for the 7% equity investment in CuraGen by Bayer AG and US$39m (GB£ 26.13m) in committed funding to CuraGen. Bayer AG and CuraGen Corporation also formed an obesity and diabetes alliance.

Percent Sought:

7.000%

Original Offer Price:

$124,090,000

Closing Offer Price:

$124,090,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$124,089,966

Total Invested Capital:

$124,090,000

Base Equity Price:

$124,090,000

EFFECTIVE DATE: July 1, 1998



DEAL NO.: 108284


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 1998

Deal Description:

Agfa Gevaert NV, Mortsel, Belgium, the photographic and electronic imaging subsidiary of Bayer AG, Germany, the chemicals group, acquired Monotype Typography Inc, Chicago, US, the producer of software for computers and peripherals. Under the terms of the deal, Monotype Typography Inc will continue its worldwide business activities under its own name and under the same management. Terms not disclosed.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 1, 1995

Deal Description:

Agfa-Gevaert, photographic subsidiary of Bayer, Germany, chemicals company, acquired the printing plates business of Hoechst, Germany, fellow chemicals company and the worlds largest producers of offset printing plates, marketed under the Ozasol brand. Consideration DM700m (£252m).

100.000%

$393,805,000

$393,805,000

Terms:

Available
